summary.long: Hosea is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord which came to Hosea the son of Beeri, during the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and during the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord first spoke through Hosea, the Lord said to Hosea, “Go, take to yourself a wife of harlotry and have children of harlotry; for the land commits flagrant harlotry, forsaking the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, “Name him Jezreel; for yet a little while, and I will punish the house of Jehu for the bloodshed of Jezreel, and I will put an end to the kingdom of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will break the bow of Israel in the valley of Jezreel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she conceived again and gave birth to a daughter. And the Lord said to him, “Name her Lo-ruhamah, for I will no longer have compassion on the house of Israel, that I would ever forgive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will have compassion on the house of Judah and deliver them by the Lord their God, and will not deliver them by bow, sword, battle, horses or horsemen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had weaned Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Name him Lo-ammi, for you are not My people and I am not your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet the number of the sons of Israel
Will be like the sand of the sea,
Which cannot be measured or numbered;
And in the place
Where it is said to them,
“You are not My people,”
It will be said to them,
“You are the sons of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the sons of Judah and the sons of Israel will be gathered together,
And they will appoint for themselves one leader,
And they will go up from the land,
For great will be the day of Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to your brothers, “Ammi,” and to your sisters, “Ruhamah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Contend with your mother, contend,
For she is not my wife, and I am not her husband;
And let her put away her harlotry from her face
And her adultery from between her breasts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or I will strip her naked
And expose her as on the day when she was born.
I will also make her like a wilderness,
Make her like desert land
And slay her with thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Also, I will have no compassion on her children,
Because they are children of harlotry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For their mother has played the harlot;
She who conceived them has acted shamefully.
For she said, ‘I will go after my lovers,
Who give me my bread and my water,
My wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, behold, I will hedge up her way with thorns,
And I will build a wall against her so that she cannot find her paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“She will pursue her lovers, but she will not overtake them;
And she will seek them, but will not find them.
Then she will say, ‘I will go back to my first husband,
For it was better for me then than now!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For she does not know that it was I who gave her the grain, the new wine and the oil,
And lavished on her silver and gold,
Which they used for Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, I will take back My grain at harvest time
And My new wine in its season.
I will also take away My wool and My flax
Given to cover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And then I will uncover her lewdness
In the sight of her lovers,
And no one will rescue her out of My hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will also put an end to all her gaiety,
Her feasts, her new moons, her sabbaths
And all her festal assemblies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will destroy her vines and fig trees,
Of which she said, ‘These are my wages
Which my lovers have given me.’
And I will make them a forest,
And the beasts of the field will devour them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will punish her for the days of the Baals
When she used to offer sacrifices to them
And adorn herself with her earrings and jewelry,
And follow her lovers, so that she forgot Me,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, behold, I will allure her,
Bring her into the wilderness
And speak kindly to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then I will give her her vineyards from there,
And the valley of Achor as a door of hope.
And she will sing there as in the days of her youth,
As in the day when she came up from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“It will come about in that day,” declares the Lord,
“That you will call Me Ishi
And will no longer call Me Baali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For I will remove the names of the Baals from her mouth,
So that they will be mentioned by their names no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In that day I will also make a covenant for them
With the beasts of the field,
The birds of the sky
And the creeping things of the ground.
And I will abolish the bow, the sword and war from the land,
And will make them lie down in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness.
Then you will know the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“It will come about in that day that I will respond,” declares the Lord.
“I will respond to the heavens, and they will respond to the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the earth will respond to the grain, to the new wine and to the oil,
And they will respond to Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will sow her for Myself in the land.
I will also have compassion on her who had not obtained compassion,
And I will say to those who were not My people,
‘You are My people!’
And they will say, ‘You are my God!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Go again, love a woman who is loved by her husband, yet an adulteress, even as the Lord loves the sons of Israel, though they turn to other gods and love raisin cakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought her for myself for fifteen shekels of silver and a homer and a half of barley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to her, “You shall stay with me for many days. You shall not play the harlot, nor shall you have a man; so I will also be toward you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the sons of Israel will remain for many days without king or prince, without sacrifice or sacred pillar and without ephod or household idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward the sons of Israel will return and seek the Lord their God and David their king; and they will come trembling to the Lord and to His goodness in the last days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to the word of the Lord, O sons of Israel,
For the Lord has a case against the inhabitants of the land,
Because there is no faithfulness or kindness
Or knowledge of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is swearing, deception, murder, stealing and adultery.
They employ violence, so that bloodshed follows bloodshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the land mourns,
And everyone who lives in it languishes
Along with the beasts of the field and the birds of the sky,
And also the fish of the sea disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet let no one find fault, and let none offer reproof;
For your people are like those who contend with the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge.
Because you have rejected knowledge,
I also will reject you from being My priest.
Since you have forgotten the law of your God,
I also will forget your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The more they multiplied, the more they sinned against Me;
I will change their glory into shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They feed on the sin of My people
And direct their desire toward their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Harlotry, wine and new wine take away the understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They offer sacrifices on the tops of the mountains
And burn incense on the hills,
Under oak, poplar and terebinth,
Because their shade is pleasant.
Therefore your daughters play the harlot
And your brides commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not punish your daughters when they play the harlot
Or your brides when they commit adultery,
For the men themselves go apart with harlots
And offer sacrifices with temple prostitutes;
So the people without understanding are ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you, Israel, play the harlot,
Do not let Judah become guilty;
Also do not go to Gilgal,
Or go up to Beth-aven
And take the oath:
“As the Lord lives!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since Israel is stubborn
Like a stubborn heifer,
Can the Lord now pasture them
Like a lamb in a large field?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is joined to idols;
Let him alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The wind wraps them in its wings,
And they will be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, O priests!
Give heed, O house of Israel!
Listen, O house of the king!
For the judgment applies to you,
For you have been a snare at Mizpah
And a net spread out on Tabor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The revolters have gone deep in depravity,
But I will chastise all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their deeds will not allow them
To return to their God.
For a spirit of harlotry is within them,
And they do not know the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have dealt treacherously against the Lord,
For they have borne illegitimate children.
Now the new moon will devour them with their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blow the horn in Gibeah,
The trumpet in Ramah.
Sound an alarm at Beth-aven:
“Behind you, Benjamin!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim will become a desolation in the day of rebuke;
Among the tribes of Israel I declare what is sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princes of Judah have become like those who move a boundary;
On them I will pour out My wrath like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is oppressed, crushed in judgment,
Because he was determined to follow man’s command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I am like a moth to Ephraim
And like rottenness to the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Ephraim saw his sickness,
And Judah his wound,
Then Ephraim went to Assyria
And sent to King Jareb.
But he is unable to heal you,
Or to cure you of your wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will be like a lion to Ephraim
And like a young lion to the house of Judah.
I, even I, will tear to pieces and go away,
I will carry away, and there will be none to deliver.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“So let us know, let us press on to know the Lord.
His going forth is as certain as the dawn;
And He will come to us like the rain,
Like the spring rain watering the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall I do with you, O Ephraim?
What shall I do with you, O Judah?
For your loyalty is like a morning cloud
And like the dew which goes away early.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I delight in loyalty rather than sacrifice,
And in the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But like Adam they have transgressed the covenant;
There they have dealt treacherously against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gilead is a city of wrongdoers,
Tracked with bloody footprints.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing;
Ephraim’s harlotry is there, Israel has defiled itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also, O Judah, there is a harvest appointed for you,
When I restore the fortunes of My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I would heal Israel,
The iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered,
And the evil deeds of Samaria,
For they deal falsely;
The thief enters in,
Bandits raid outside,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they do not consider in their hearts
That I remember all their wickedness.
Now their deeds are all around them;
They are before My face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With their wickedness they make the king glad,
And the princes with their lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all adulterers,
Like an oven heated by the baker
Who ceases to stir up the fire
From the kneading of the dough until it is leavened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the day of our king, the princes became sick with the heat of wine;
He stretched out his hand with scoffers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their hearts are like an oven
As they approach their plotting;
Their anger smolders all night,
In the morning it burns like a flaming fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of them are hot like an oven,
And they consume their rulers;
All their kings have fallen.
None of them calls on Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim mixes himself with the nations;
Ephraim has become a cake not turned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strangers devour his strength,
Yet he does not know it;
Gray hairs also are sprinkled on him,
Yet he does not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the pride of Israel testifies against him,
Yet they have not returned to the Lord their God,
Nor have they sought Him, for all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Ephraim has become like a silly dove, without sense;
They call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to them, for they have strayed from Me!
Destruction is theirs, for they have rebelled against Me!
I would redeem them, but they speak lies against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they do not cry to Me from their heart
When they wail on their beds;
For the sake of grain and new wine they assemble themselves,
They turn away from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although I trained and strengthened their arms,
Yet they devise evil against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They turn, but not upward,
They are like a deceitful bow;
Their princes will fall by the sword
Because of the insolence of their tongue.
This will be their derision in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put the trumpet to your lips!
Like an eagle the enemy comes against the house of the Lord,
Because they have transgressed My covenant
And rebelled against My law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cry out to Me,
“My God, we of Israel know You!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel has rejected the good;
The enemy will pursue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have set up kings, but not by Me;
They have appointed princes, but I did not know it.
With their silver and gold they have made idols for themselves,
That they might be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has rejected your calf, O Samaria, saying,
“My anger burns against them!”
How long will they be incapable of innocence?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For they sow the wind
And they reap the whirlwind.
The standing grain has no heads;
It yields no grain.
Should it yield, strangers would swallow it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Even though they hire allies among the nations,
Now I will gather them up;
And they will begin to diminish
Because of the burden of the king of princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since Ephraim has multiplied altars for sin,
They have become altars of sinning for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I wrote for him ten thousand precepts of My law,
They are regarded as a strange thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for My sacrificial gifts,
They sacrifice the flesh and eat it,
But the Lord has taken no delight in them.
Now He will remember their iniquity,
And punish them for their sins;
They will return to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rejoice, O Israel, with exultation like the nations!
For you have played the harlot, forsaking your God.
You have loved harlots’ earnings on every threshing floor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Threshing floor and wine press will not feed them,
And the new wine will fail them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will not remain in the Lord’s land,
But Ephraim will return to Egypt,
And in Assyria they will eat unclean food.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
What will you do on the day of the appointed festival
And on the day of the feast of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The days of punishment have come,
The days of retribution have come;
Let Israel know this!
The prophet is a fool,
The inspired man is demented,
Because of the grossness of your iniquity,
And because your hostility is so great.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have gone deep in depravity
As in the days of Gibeah;
He will remember their iniquity,
He will punish their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness;
I saw your forefathers as the earliest fruit on the fig tree in its first season.
But they came to Baal-peor and devoted themselves to shame,
And they became as detestable as that which they loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for Ephraim, their glory will fly away like a bird—
No birth, no pregnancy and no conception!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though they bring up their children,
Yet I will bereave them until not a man is left.
Yes, woe to them indeed when I depart from them!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give them, O Lord—what will You give?
Give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is stricken, their root is dried up,
They will bear no fruit.
Even though they bear children,
I will slay the precious ones of their womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart is faithless;
Now they must bear their guilt.
The Lord will break down their altars
And destroy their sacred pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely now they will say, “We have no king,
For we do not revere the Lord.
As for the king, what can he do for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The inhabitants of Samaria will fear
For the calf of Beth-aven.
Indeed, its people will mourn for it,
And its idolatrous priests will cry out over it,
Over its glory, since it has departed from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thing itself will be carried to Assyria
As tribute to King Jareb;
Ephraim will be seized with shame
And Israel will be ashamed of its own counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Samaria will be cut off with her king
Like a stick on the surface of the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is a trained heifer that loves to thresh,
But I will come over her fair neck with a yoke;
I will harness Ephraim,
Judah will plow, Jacob will harrow for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sow with a view to righteousness,
Reap in accordance with kindness;
Break up your fallow ground,
For it is time to seek the Lord
Until He comes to rain righteousness on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have plowed wickedness, you have reaped injustice,
You have eaten the fruit of lies.
Because you have trusted in your way, in your numerous warriors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore a tumult will arise among your people,
And all your fortresses will be destroyed,
As Shalman destroyed Beth-arbel on the day of battle,
When mothers were dashed in pieces with their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus it will be done to you at Bethel because of your great wickedness.
At dawn the king of Israel will be completely cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Israel was a youth I loved him,
And out of Egypt I called My son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The more they called them,
The more they went from them;
They kept sacrificing to the Baals
And burning incense to idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The sword will whirl against their cities,
And will demolish their gate bars
And consume them because of their counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So My people are bent on turning from Me.
Though they call them to the One on high,
None at all exalts Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can I give you up, O Ephraim?
How can I surrender you, O Israel?
How can I make you like Admah?
How can I treat you like Zeboiim?
My heart is turned over within Me,
All My compassions are kindled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not execute My fierce anger;
I will not destroy Ephraim again.
For I am God and not man, the Holy One in your midst,
And I will not come in wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will walk after the Lord,
He will roar like a lion;
Indeed He will roar
And His sons will come trembling from the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim surrounds Me with lies
And the house of Israel with deceit;
Judah is also unruly against God,
Even against the Holy One who is faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim feeds on wind,
And pursues the east wind continually;
He multiplies lies and violence.
Moreover, he makes a covenant with Assyria,
And oil is carried to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In the womb he took his brother by the heel,
And in his maturity he contended with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, he wrestled with the angel and prevailed;
He wept and sought His favor.
He found Him at Bethel
And there He spoke with us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the Lord, the God of hosts,
The Lord is His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, return to your God,
Observe kindness and justice,
And wait for your God continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A merchant, in whose hands are false balances,
He loves to oppress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Ephraim said, “Surely I have become rich,
I have found wealth for myself;
In all my labors they will find in me
No iniquity, which would be sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have also spoken to the prophets,
And I gave numerous visions,
And through the prophets I gave parables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there iniquity in Gilead?
Surely they are worthless.
In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls,
Yes, their altars are like the stone heaps
Beside the furrows of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Jacob fled to the land of Aram,
And Israel worked for a wife,
And for a wife he kept sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But by a prophet the Lord brought Israel from Egypt,
And by a prophet he was kept.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling.
He exalted himself in Israel,
But through Baal he did wrong and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now they sin more and more,
And make for themselves molten images,
Idols skillfully made from their silver,
All of them the work of craftsmen.
They say of them, “Let the men who sacrifice kiss the calves!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they will be like the morning cloud
And like dew which soon disappears,
Like chaff which is blown away from the threshing floor
And like smoke from a chimney.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I have been the Lord your God
Since the land of Egypt;
And you were not to know any god except Me,
For there is no savior besides Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cared for you in the wilderness,
In the land of drought.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So I will be like a lion to them;
Like a leopard I will lie in wait by the wayside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will encounter them like a bear robbed of her cubs,
And I will tear open their chests;
There I will also devour them like a lioness,
As a wild beast would tear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is your destruction, O Israel,
That you are against Me, against your help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where now is your king
That he may save you in all your cities,
And your judges of whom you requested,
“Give me a king and princes”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I gave you a king in My anger
And took him away in My wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up;
His sin is stored up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Shall I ransom them from the power of Sheol?
Shall I redeem them from death?
O Death, where are your thorns?
O Sheol, where is your sting?
Compassion will be hidden from My sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Samaria will be held guilty,
For she has rebelled against her God.
They will fall by the sword,
Their little ones will be dashed in pieces,
And their pregnant women will be ripped open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, O Israel, to the Lord your God,
For you have stumbled because of your iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take words with you and return to the Lord.
Say to Him, “Take away all iniquity
And receive us graciously,
That we may present the fruit of our lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will heal their apostasy,
I will love them freely,
For My anger has turned away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
His shoots will sprout,
And his beauty will be like the olive tree
And his fragrance like the cedars of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who live in his shadow
Will again raise grain,
And they will blossom like the vine.
His renown will be like the wine of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Ephraim, what more have I to do with idols?
It is I who answer and look after you.
I am like a luxuriant cypress;
From Me comes your fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is wise, let him understand these things;
Whoever is discerning, let him know them.
For the ways of the Lord are right,
And the righteous will walk in them,
But transgressors will stumble in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
